intro: Pabstiella verboonenii, commonly known as the Bornean moonseed, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a fleshy, berry-like structure that contains several seeds. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, Pabstiella verboonenii is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
